sen.j: 万寿寺通（まんじゅじどおり）は京都市内の東西の通りの一つ。
sen.e: Manjuji-dori Street is one of the streets at east and west in Kyoto City.
Manjuji-dori Street is a street running east-west through Kyoto City.
Manjuji-dori Street is a street running east-west through Kyoto City.

sen.j: 平安京の樋口小路にあたる。
sen.e: It used to be Higuchikoji in Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Higuchikoji in Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Higuchikoji in Heiankyo.
It runs between Matsubara-dori Street and Gojo-dori Street.
It runs between Matsubara-dori Street and Gojo-dori Street.
It runs between Matsubara-dori Street and Gojo-dori Street.

sen.j: 東は寺町通と河原町通の交差点から、西は葛野西通まで。
sen.e: The street is from the crossing between Teramachi-dori Street and Kawaramachi-dori Street at east to Kuzunonishi-dori Street at west.
The street begins at the intersection of Teramachi-dori Street and Kawaramachi-dori Street in the east to Kuzunonishi-dori Street in the west.
The street begins at the intersection of Teramachi-dori Street and Kawaramachi-dori Street in the east to Kuzunonishi-dori Street in the west.

sen.j: 東の延長線上の路地と、さらに東の鴨川 (淀川水系)をはさんで六波羅裏門通につながる道も万寿寺通の名前で呼ばれることがある。
sen.e: The street extended to east, and the street which is across the Kamo River and connects to Rokuharauramon-dori Street at east, are also called Manjuji-dori Street.
The street which extends east, and the street across the Kamo River which connects to Rokuharauramon-dori Street in the east, are also called Manjuji-dori Street.
The street which extends east, and the street across the Kamo-gawa River which connects to Rokuharauramon-dori Street in the east, are also called Manjuji-dori Street.

sen.j: 途中堀川通から下松屋町通、千本通から東新道一筋東、東御前通から西土居通、佐井西通から葛野東通で分断されている。
sen.e: On the way, the street is divided from Horikawa dori Streeto to Shimomatsuyamachi-dori Street, from Senbon-dori Street to one street east on Higashi Shinmichi, from Higashi Onmae-dori Street to Nishi Dori-dori Street, and from Sainishi-dori Street to Kuzunohigashi-dori Street.

On the way, the street is divided from Horikawa dori Streeto to Shimomatsuyamachi-dori Street, from Senbon-dori Street to one street east on Higashi Shinmichi, from Higashi Onmae-dori Street to Nishi Dori-dori Street, and from Sainishi-dori Street to Kuzunohigashi-dori Street.

On the way, the street is divided from Horikawa-dori Street to Shimomatsuyamachi-dori Street, from Senbon-dori Street to one street east on Higashi Shinmichi, from Higashi Onmae-dori Street to Nishi Dori-dori Street, and from Sainishi-dori Street to Kuzunohigashi-dori Street.

sen.j: 寺町通と烏丸通の間は仏具店が多く、烏丸通から堀川通では和装業者が多い。
sen.e: There are many Buddhist altar fittings shops between Teramachi-dori Street and Karasuma-dori Street, and there are many Japanese clothing (Kimono) traders on between Karasuma-dori Street and Horikawa-dori Street.

There are many Buddhist altar fittings shops between Teramachi-dori Street and Karasuma-dori Street, and there are many Japanese clothing (Kimono) traders between Karasuma-dori Street and Horikawa-dori Street.

There are many Buddhist altar fittings shops between Teramachi-dori Street and Karasuma-dori Street, and there are many Japanese clothing (Kimono) traders between Karasuma-dori Street and Horikawa-dori Street.

sen.j: 通りの名は東洞院通との交差点にかつてあった京都五山の一つ万寿寺に由来する。
sen.e: The name of the street came from Manju-ji Temple which is one of the Kyoto Gozan that used to exist at the crossing between Higashinotoin-dori Street.
The name of the street came from Manju-ji Temple which is one of the Kyoto Gozan that used to exist at the crossing between Higashinotoin-dori Street.
The name of the street came from Manju-ji Temple which is one of the Kyoto Gozan (Five Great zen Temples of Kyoto) that used to exist at the crossing between Higashinotoin-dori Street.
